perturbation.original_text:
18.4
No Other Liability. IN NO EVENT SHALL EITHER PARTY BE LIABLE TO THE OTHER FOR ANY INCIDENTAL, CONSEQUENTIAL,
SPECIAL OR PUNITIVE DAMAGES OF ANY KIND OR NATURE ARISING OUT OF THIS AGREEMENT OR THE SALE OF PRODUCTS,
WHETHER SUCH LIABILITY IS ASSERTED ON THE BASIS OF CONTRACT, TORT (INCLUDING THE POSSIBILITY OF NEGLIGENCE OR
STRICT LIABILITY), OR OTHERWISE, EVEN IF THE PARTY HAS BEEN WARNED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF ANY SUCH LOSS OR
DAMAGE. AND EVEN IF ANY OF THE LIMITED REMEDIES IN THIS AGREEMENT FAIL OF THEIR ESSENTIAL PURPOSE. IN
ADDITION, NOTWITHSTANDING ANYTHING TO THE CONTRARY HEREIN OR OTHERWISE, THE PARTIES ACKNOWLEDGE THAT
AS AN ELECTRONIC MANUFACTURING SERVICES PROVIDER WORKING ON A COST PLUS BASIS SUPPLIER MUST LIMIT ITS
LIABILITY IN CONNECTION HEREWITH AND THEREFORE, CONTRACTOR’S LIABILITY IS FURTHER LIMITED IN ANY EVENT,
UNDER ANY LAW, RULE OR REGULATION, TO ANY AMOUNT IT ACTUALLY RECEIVED IN CONSIDERATION OF THE
MANUFACTURING SUBJECT MATTER OF THE RESPECTIVE CLAIM OR DEMAND BY CUSTOMER OR ANY THIRD PARTY.
perturbation.changed_text:
22.10 Insurance. Customer specifically agrees to maintain insurance coverage for any finished Products or materials which passes to Customer
pursuant to this Agreement and which is stored on the premises of Contractor.
18.4
No Other Liability. IN NO EVENT SHALL EITHER PARTY BE LIABLE TO THE OTHER FOR ANY INCIDENTAL, CONSEQUENTIAL,
SPECIAL OR PUNITIVE DAMAGES OF ANY KIND OR NATURE ARISING OUT OF THIS AGREEMENT OR THE SALE OF PRODUCTS,
WHETHER SUCH LIABILITY IS ASSERTED ON THE BASIS OF CONTRACT, TORT (INCLUDING THE POSSIBILITY OF NEGLIGENCE OR
STRICT LIABILITY), OR OTHERWISE, EVEN IF THE PARTY HAS BEEN WARNED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF ANY SUCH LOSS OR
DAMAGE. AND EVEN IF ANY OF THE LIMITED REMEDIES IN THIS AGREEMENT FAIL OF THEIR ESSENTIAL PURPOSE. IN
ADDITION, NOTWITHSTANDING ANYTHING TO THE CONTRARY HEREIN OR OTHERWISE, THE PARTIES ACKNOWLEDGE THAT
AS AN ELECTRONIC MANUFACTURING SERVICES PROVIDER WORKING ON A COST PLUS BASIS SUPPLIER MUST LIMIT ITS
LIABILITY IN CONNECTION HEREWITH AND THEREFORE, CONTRACTOR’S LIABILITY IS FURTHER LIMITED IN ANY EVENT,
UNDER ANY LAW, RULE OR REGULATION, TO ANY AMOUNT IT ACTUALLY RECEIVED IN CONSIDERATION OF THE
MANUFACTURING SUBJECT MATTER OF THE RESPECTIVE CLAIM OR DEMAND BY CUSTOMER OR ANY THIRD PARTY.
perturbation.explanation: Moving the insurance clause to the Liability section makes it less visible and harder to enforce. Insurance clauses are typically grouped with general terms rather than liability limitations. This misplacement obscures the Customer's obligation to maintain insurance and could lead to disputes over coverage in case of damage or loss.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General principles of contract law regarding conspicuousness and clarity of terms, particularly insurance obligations.

perturbation.original_text:
17.3
Should the foregoing procedure not bring a mutually satisfactory solution within 30 days, each party will be free to proceed according to
applicable law.
perturbation.changed_text:
22.3
Relationship of the Parties. Each of the parties shall at all times during the term of this Agreement act as, and shall represent itself to be, an
independent contractor. Neither Party shall have any right or authority to assume or create any obligations or to make any representations or
warranties on behalf of the other parry whether express or implied, or to bind the other party in a respect whatsoever.
17.3
Should the foregoing procedure not bring a mutually satisfactory solution within 30 days, each party will be free to proceed according to
applicable law.
perturbation.explanation: Moving the 'Relationship of the Parties' clause from general provisions to the Dispute Resolution section. This obscures the intended independent contractor status and can mislead a reader into thinking it only applies to dispute scenarios. This may introduce uncertainty about the general relationship between parties.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General principles of contract law requiring clarity in defining party relationships and obligations.

perturbation.original_text:
22.4
Governing Law. The construction, interpretation and performance of this Agreement and all transactions under it shall be governed by the
law of the State of Israel, without giving effect to choice of law rules, and both Parties consent to jurisdiction by the courts of the City of
Haifa.
perturbation.changed_text:
4.2
Customer’s production facilities
Contractor will be obliged to allocate to Customer, production and storage space as well as trained production and testing personnel as an
integral part of this Agreement. Contractor shall apply for and receive the ISO13488 standard for the production facility, by no later than .
During the term of this Agreement, the manufacturing services provided by the Contractor hereto shall confirm in all material respects with
the ISOl3488 standard.
22.4
Governing Law. The construction, interpretation and performance of this Agreement and all transactions under it shall be governed by the
law of the State of Israel, without giving effect to choice of law rules, and both Parties consent to jurisdiction by the courts of the City of
Haifa.
perturbation.explanation: Moving the 'Governing Law' clause to Section 4, 'Contractor's Obligations'. This is highly unusual, as governing law clauses are typically placed in the general provisions section. This misplacement reduces the prominence and accessibility of the governing law clause, potentially leading to confusion or disputes over which jurisdiction's laws apply.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General contract law principles requiring clarity and proper placement of essential terms like governing law.
